page.title: 05Fishing
page.content: The river Coquet flows through Rothbury and it is very popular for fishing. Large salmon and sea trout are quite often caught, sometimes up to twenty pounds in weight. You have to buy a license to fish for them or for brown trout. There is a shop in the village which sells licenses once you have decided which kind you want. Some of the fishing rights are owned by the local angling club and some by the Northumberland Federation so you need a book which clearly indicates the parts you can fish. Most people seem to use artificial fly but the biggest fish are caught either on worm or the spinner. There is a deep pool at the old Thrum Mill just outside Rothbury where most of the big fish are caught.
